definition[0]: officially described as being something, when this is not really true
example[0]: the nominal head of the rebellion
example[1]: Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
definition[1]: relating to nouns or used as a noun
example[2]: the nominal use of the present participle
definition[2]: someone who has the title of head, leader etc but does not have the normal responsibilities, powers etc of that job
example[3]: Although he remained the nominal head of the campaign, his deputy took over responsibility for it.
definition[3]: a nominal sum of money is very small, compared to the usual amount that would be paid or charged for something
example[4]: He charges a nominal amount for his software, enough to cover expenses.
definition[4]: a nominal figure, level etc is not the real one because something such as inflation has not been taken into account
example[5]: While the Fed can peg the nominal federal funds rate, it cannot control the real rate (i.e. the nominal rate minus the rate of inflation).
